intro: Campylospermum beccarianum, commonly known as the beccarian sandmat, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically white or pale in color. The species is noted for its ability to store water in its thick leaves, making it well adapted to dry conditions.
